website_summaries.verdict: The Olympus OM-D E-M5 is the best Micro Four Thirds camera we've tested. It's got a top-notch stabilization system, is fully weather sealed, can shoot in all types of light, and ships with a sharp and versatile kit lens. Add it all up, and you have our new Editors' Choice for high-end compact interchangeable lens cameras.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good CSC for a while, mainly to complement my DSLR gear. While I absolutely love the image quality, speed and capabilities of my Canon Dx and FF cameras, the biggest issue was the weight and bulk of the camera equipment. Constantly carrying a heavy DSLR with a professional lens is not only impractical, but it is also painful. The day I started using the E-M5, I just fell in love with it. Everything just felt right about it – excellent image quality, incredibly fast auto focus, wide lens selection, superior ergonomics with a boatload of customization options and it's very handy.
customer_reviews.author: R Racaza

customer_reviews.title: small but beautifully formed
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I use it with a panasonic 35-100mm 2.8 zoom and it is wonderfully light. Combined with an EM1 with 12-40mm 2.8, I have a 2 camera set up and never need to change lenses. As has been said before the buttons are smaller and harder to reach and there are less available on the body than the EM1. I moved to micro 2 3rds because I am disabled and need the lighter gear. Was worried about IQ (coming from a Canon 6D) but you seem to get 2 stops more than I did back in the days of fast 35mm film, so I am happy. If it's too easy, it takes away the fun!
customer_reviews.author: pillbox

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera! Lightweight, classic look. Good grips. Controls easy to get your head round. Built in viewfinder very helpful especially in bright sunlight. Liveview screen helpful for framing a shot. Plenty of lenses to choose from. This is my fourth M4/3s camera now and each one has been better than the last. Images easily as good as any DSLR I've had (3) and I would never go back. Nothing to fault here.
customer_reviews.author: JoGo

customer_reviews.title: Good for someone who have use camera too much before
customer_reviews.text: It is one of the great mirror-less camera. It comes with the water-resistant and the best picture modes, also the great hardware to support overall in the camera process. I would recommend this product for someone who want to use camera type as a semi-pro camera because in my by the accessories and weight of this product, it seem like a bit heavy than another camera in the sme type and some camera modes or some set-up menus weren't easy to use for the starter.
customer_reviews.author: Pawitra S.

customer_reviews.title: time for an update
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with my new camera, been using Olympus cameras for 30+ years and this latest purchase really does not disappoint at all. I would say buy just the body and a lens separate as the supplied lens does not do the camera justice, the video is way better than I expected too - so take the plunge you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile change.
customer_reviews.text: Quite different to a Canon, feels solid, menu system seems complicated at first but is now smooth to use. The grip kit si in two parts, the first really only gives a better grip which is a huge advantage and it adds almost no extra weight, the second part houses an extra battery it improves the camera balance when a larger lens is used.
customer_reviews.author: John Wishart

customer_reviews.title: ... for over 10 years but this has been a delight to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used Canon for over 10 years but this has been a delight to use. A bit small but much better with the added grip. I would say that it's not great for sports but the results with the 45mm 1.8 are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Best MFT camera
customer_reviews.text: Super MFT camera, overwhelming amount of technology for such a small unit.Able to take Olympus and Panasonic lenses.Robust weather proof body.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth P.

customer_reviews.title: Different
customer_reviews.text: I like the old style of the camera and always gets some attentions from the camera enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: small is beautiful
customer_reviews.text: A good deal on a camera I had wanted for some time. Although I should love to have the extra 500 to spend on the M1, this does not disappoint and falls nicely to the hand - it really is small for its power!
customer_reviews.author: Westdale

customer_reviews.title: 12/50 mm lens has had some bad press. In fact it's a super lens- a ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than expected. 12/50 mm lens has had some bad press. In fact it's a super lens- a very useful macro function (86 mm equivalent), you can expect to produce decent quality A3 prints throughout the range. The camera is lovely to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this since last August... it is a great camera and I might even buy another if the price drops a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Entropy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant camera.
customer_reviews.text: All the plaudits were correct for this brilliant camera, very pleased with the service also.
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice still to try out in earnest but takes very good photos in auto mode nice and compact
customer_reviews.author: Neil H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It takes the best pics and the touch screen focus is excellent. This camera actually made me want to figure out how to use it because it has all the bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Carson MB

customer_reviews.title: top class
customer_reviews.text: when I received the camera I thought that it may be to small. however ,walking a lot I found that its weight was great. then the lens 12/50 was beyond my expectations no problems whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: david addis

customer_reviews.title: all good so far
customer_reviews.text: Just started using the Olympus, always been a Nikon user, all good so far, excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mr  D  James

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with the versatility of this camera and can thoroughly ...
customer_reviews.text: Met all of my expectations and more! Delighted with the versatility of this camera and can thoroughly recommend it for amateurs and professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Collingwood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. If you want a change from Panasonic this is the camera to get. It takes all the lens and is just as easy to use. It's a very creative camera with all the built in settings. Nice size and weight and the silver one is the best looking camera I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie_in_Guernsey

customer_reviews.title: olympus omd em5
customer_reviews.text: great camera,fantastic delivery.takes brilliant pictures .i don't know why I struggled carrying a great heavy slr camera,as this camera takes brilliant photos and only a fraction of the weight
customer_reviews.author: Norman Moss

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice package, all in an excellent shape. :) I have no complaints. :)
customer_reviews.author: Morpho Pyrrou

customer_reviews.title: As used, the Oly E-M5 had faulty flash turret.
customer_reviews.text: The model is excellent but purchased as used it had a fault that eventually cost me £100 to get fixed
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Heath

customer_reviews.title: The very best micro four thirds body!!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others I have finally sold my much heavier Nikon kit and feel much happier using this camera with a selection of quality prime lenses. In my opinion the quality of my pics. has NOT decreased at all and, at 76, enjoy a much smaller and lighter camera bag!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely pleased. The new wave of the photography
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely pleased. The new wave of the photography. 4/3 micro. The new system. No more RAW for "salvation picture", no more blur on the pictures - all photo clear and very detailised. Highly recommend for them who are bother to carry the heavy case with thick lens and want just to see the beauty of world.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. O.Robert

customer_reviews.title: Superb results!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is one of the best specified and best performing around even when compared to the professional full frame category. There is a multitude of customisable options, which means it is very easy to personalise. The camera as many people remark is smaller than expected but feels weighty and solid. The only reason I would not give 5 stars for this beautiful little object is that the back buttons are plastic and feel a little fragile. An internet search shows that in some cases some of the buttons become detached if treated roughly, including the top control wheel. Knowing this I still went ahead and got the OMD + Lens as the pro's are huge compared to the con's.
customer_reviews.author: Simon B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good camera at a good price. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've got 3 full frame DSLRs and 10 other DSLRs. However, I take this camera everywhere! A great imaging device. Wouldn't be without it!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent... I bought two!
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best place to write a review of this camera but suffice it to say that it certainly feels like some photographers have designed it to be used to take pictures and not just to 'out-spec' the competition. It's a sensible photographic tool and well thought out except for the silly on/off switch but after a while you forget about that aspect and appreciate its virtues. I bought my OM-Ds as a stop-gap with a view to the E-6 which I hope appears this year. The new 16mp sensor is a dream compared to previous ones and not just because of pixel count.
customer_reviews.author: alanscape

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, but...
customer_reviews.text: Have some bugs still need to improve. For example, some images are taken and are completely dark. I bought the body only, black color. It came with a small problem in the paint near the usb port. I'm really impressed with the colour and sharpness. Very customizable.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ricardo Maciel Rubiao

customer_reviews.title: Small and good
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy to use. Came well packaged. I was a little nervous not to have a traditional slr. However this feels like a compact and function like an slr
customer_reviews.author: wrightstuff

customer_reviews.title: Top of all EVIL camera
customer_reviews.text: Vintage body design, impressive functionality , even just the kit lens can deliver such stunning image quality especially in the macro mode, great job Olympus, but the 12mm f2.0 is still pricey ,its better to manage it around £450, because the omd-em5 is born to live with the 12mm f2.0 lens. You guys know what i mean=]
customer_reviews.author: Colson

customer_reviews.title: Visually splendid!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I could say about this great camera (along with its few foibles - nothing is perfect) has already been said, so I'll just stick with saying that, in silver, with a silver 45mm f1.8 attached, it is the best looking digital camera ever! I keep having to pick it up and look at it. Bye bye to my Canon gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mooncoin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had this for over a year now and love it to pieces...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Wheeler-wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great camera when it works...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my OM-D freezes so frequently as to be unusable. Which is a shame, because I'm really happy with the camera otherwise. Hopefully it's just a "dud" model that I've got - I look forward to getting a new one from Olympus and trying again...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. J. Holden

customer_reviews.title: To buy or not?
customer_reviews.text: It is very expensive and very small - bad&good. I would like to try it for a week to see its weakness and positives before I order, I like the touch screen very much, but lenses properties are not really what I look for. They are small, but can they compete with Canons L/USM? Mostly photos of flowers, and fountains with blurred water on forums. I cant stand DSLR bulkiness but then M4/3 is not a proper replacement - very expensive. Or maybe DSLRs should be cheaper? 8-)
customer_reviews.author: Pen Teller

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M5 16MP Live MOS Interchangeable Lens Camera with 3.0-Inch Tilting OLED Touchscreen and 12-50mm Lens (Silver) - International Version (No Warranty)

The Olympus E-M5: Finally, what the world of photography has been waiting for Dust and splash-proof design

feature_bullets: This version is originally intended for sale outside the US and may contain adapters, manuals, and warranties not compatible with US standards.
